Belgium

Group G | Europe

Carbonnade Flamande

The best chips (aka fries) in the world, the best beer, and maybe the best footballers? Belgium has a squad that could go all the way this year and this meat stew from the BBC has strong potential too.

A filling meal suitable for De Rode Duivels, this rich, beer-braised dish is best accompanied by a Belgian brew and watching Kevin De Bruyne complete a flashy pass up to Romelu Lukaku.

  • Time 2hrs 30mins
  • Makes 4
  • Difficulty Semi-Pro
  • Units Imperial Metric

Ingredients

  • 15g Butter
    1 tbsp
    15g
    Butter
  • 450g Diced beef
    1lb
    450g
    Diced beef
  • 125g Pancetta
    4oz
    125g
    Pancetta diced
  • 1 Onion
    1
    1
    Onion sliced
  • 1 Carrot
    1
    1
    Carrot sliced
  • 2 cloves Garlic
    2 cloves
    2 cloves
    Garlic minced
  • 1 tsp Plain flour
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    Plain flour
  • 250ml Beef stock
    1 cup
    250ml
    Beef stock
  • 1 tsp Tomato purée
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    Tomato purée
  • 400ml Brown or dark Belgian ale
    1 ½ cups
    400ml
    Brown or dark Belgian ale
  • handful Parsley
    handful
    handful
    Parsley chopped
  • 1
    Over a high heat, melt the butter in a large cassrole dish or dutch oven on a high heat. Add the diced beef and cook until browned on all sides. Remove beef and reserve.
  • 2
    Turn the heat down to medium and cook the pancetta for 5 minutes.
  • 3
    Then add the onions, carrots, garlic and cook until the onions are starting to turn translucent. Then mix in the flour and cook for a further 5 minutes.
  • 4
    Add the cooked beef, beef stock and the tomato purée and stir. Slowly pour in the Belgian ale. Bring to a simmer and then cover and cook for 2 hours until sauce has thickened.
    Coach's tip Use something like a Leffe or Duvel.
    Coach's tip Use something like a Leffe or Duvel.
  • 5
    Serve with parsley.
